guiSET.core

Class Shortcut

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiSET.core.Shortcut

  • public class Shortcut
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for storing keyboard shortcuts. Can store value for modifier keys (Control, Shift Meta and Alt) and and an additional normal key. Shortcuts can be created like Shortcut('A', true, true, false) for Ctrl-Shift-A or like Shortcut(A, CONTROL, SHIFT);
    Author:
    Mc-Zen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shortcut() 
      Shortcut(char key, boolean control, boolean shift, boolean alt) 
      Shortcut(char key, int... modifiers)
      Constructor for creating a shortcut with a key and some modifiers (order of modifiers is not important).

      static Shortcut shortcutFromKeyCode(int keyCode, int modifiers)
      A method to create a shortcut with a given keyCode instead of a key and by passing the modifiers coded as one single int (as uesd in internally in java KeyEvents).
      java.lang.String toString()
      Turn shortcut into a string in a format like: "Ctrl+Shift+Alt+K" or "Shift+Alt+3".

    • Method Detail

      • shortcutFromKeyCode

        public static Shortcut shortcutFromKeyCode(int keyCode,
                                           int modifiers)
        A method to create a shortcut with a given keyCode instead of a key and by passing the modifiers coded as one single int (as uesd in internally in java KeyEvents). Need a static method here as not to confuse the constructor overloading too much. This is only used by KeyListener as a performance-optimal constructor.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - key code
        modifiers - modifiers
        Returns:
        created shortcut
